title: How to learn React
content:
JavaScript Information

Overview

JavaScript, often abbreviated as JS, is a programming language and core technology of the Web, alongside HTML and CSS. It is used on 99% of websites for client-side webpage behavior.

Execution

Web browsers have a dedicated JavaScript engine that executes client code. These engines are also utilized in some servers and a variety of apps.

The most popular runtime system for non-browser usage is Node.js.

Features

  • High-level, often just-in-time compiled language
  • Conforms to the ECMAScript standard
  • Dynamic typing
  • Prototype-based object-orientation
  • First-class functions

Programming Paradigms

  • Event-driven
  • Functional
  • Imperative

APIs

JavaScript provides APIs for working with:

  • Text
  • Dates
  • Regular expressions
  • Standard data structures
  • Document Object Model (DOM)

Note: The ECMAScript standard does not include any input/output (I/O) functionalities; these are provided by the web browser or other runtime systems.

Distinction from Java

Although Java and JavaScript are similar in name, syntax, and respective standard libraries, they are distinct languages that differ greatly in design.
metadesc: JavaScript is a programming language and core technology of the Web, alongside HTML and CSS. It is used on 99% of websites for client-side webpage behavior.
author: Aditya
